common.upload-concent-message: By clicking upload, I confirm that my organisation's data protection policy allows me to share this data with Europass for the duration of the session, for the purpose of creating and issuing credentials.

common.login.text: You need to be logged to the page in order to access this part of the site. Please log in to your account to access it.

sessionExpired.title: Session Expired
home.main-info.title: Europass Digital Credentials
home.select-credential: Please select a type of credential you wish to create
home.main-info.description: Europass Digital Credentials are electronically sealed digital records given to a person to certify the learning they have undertaken. They can be awarded for formal education, training, online courses, volunteering experiences and more.
Issue degrees, diplomas, certificates of participation or other credentials to your learners. Any school, college, university or training provider in Europe may use this tool to issue credentials for free and secure them with their e-seal. Credentials can be e-mailed to learners or directly deposited to their Europass profiles.
This tool is a public preview, which is still in development. More features, including support for all EU languages will be added shortly. Read about our development timeline here.
prepare.section.prepare.title: Prepare
prepare.section.prepare.first-line-befor: To issue credentials, you need to obtain a qualified electronic seal. Our test tool will ensure everything is set up properly. Then, follow our tutorial to understand how to prepare your data.
prepare.selectDescription: The Online Credential Builder allows you to enter your data entirely via the browser. You may also prepare larger datasets in Excel (for Windows) using the supplied template. Alternatively, you can export a package from your student information system as XML.
prepare.uploadDescription: If you have your credential data prepared, upload the file and move on to the next step of reviewing and digitally sealing your credentials.
overview.loading-message.description-sen: If you are sending a large number of credentials, this process may take some time. Do not close or navigate away from this tab while the sending process is ongoing.
overview.loading-message.description-sea: If you are sealing a large number of credentials, this process may take some time. Do not close or navigate away from this tab while the sealing process is ongoing.
overview.reviewDetails: Before proceeding to Seal, check the accuracy of your credentials by previewing them. Click the eye icon under Actions. On sealing, the credentials will be issued and cannot be modified.
overview.selectCheckboxes: Send credentials to the recipientsâ€™ mailboxes or credential wallets.
overview.selectPresentationTypeModal.lab: I am certifying the authenticity of a credential issued by another organisation

download.template-types.label: Download your XLS template

error.autocompleteRequired: This field is required. Please select an item from the autocomplete selector.
error.maxLength.4000: Max length for this field is 4000 characters
error.number: This field should only contain numerical characters (0-9)
error.maxLength.255: Max length for this field is 255 characters
error.maxLength.9: Max length for this field is 9 characters
error.webDocument: Content is required if a title is provided
error.urlPattern: This pattern should follow the pattern http(s)://XXXXX
error.emailPattern: This field should follow the pattern xxx@yyy.zz
error.emailPatternWithComma: This field should follow the pattern xxx@yyy.zz, xxx@yyy.zz
error.legalIdentifierError: Either both fields should be filled or neither of them
error.ownerAddressError: If an address is specified, a country must be provided too
error.additionalNote: Either both fields should be filled or neither of them
error.specification: This field is mandatory if any field of the "Specification" section is supplied. Please fill this field or remove the other "Specification" fields
error.identifierError: An identifier must have a content
error.minDate: Please provide a '{{selfParam}}' that is not greater than '{{dateParam}}'
error.maxDate: Please provide an '{{selfParam}}' that is greater than '{{dateParam}}' provided.
error.noBlankSpaceOnly: This field is required, please add some content not only blank spaces
error.concentError: Please accept the data protection statement to continue
error.specificationRequired: This field is mandatory if the "title" field of the "Specification" section is supplied.
error.selectEmailOrWallet: Please, provide the email and/or wallet address

credential-builder.formNewEntityWarning: Do you want to create a new related entity? The information will be saved to be filled in later. (If it is a single input, it will be replaced by the new related entity)
credential-builder.description: Use the tabs below to build multilingual reusable templates for credentials, activities, assessments, etc. When your template is ready, click on the Issue icon to enter student data, and grades, if applicable. If you need clarification on what any field requires, scroll over the black ðŸ›ˆ icon next to the label. This tool is still in preview â€“ some of the dropdown lists may not yet be selectable.
credential-builder.deleteWarning: Are you sure you want to delete this item?
credential-builder.inputCharacters: Write any characters to trigger the search
credential-builder.concent: I confirm that my organisation's data protection policy allows me to share this data with Europass for the duration of the session, for the purpose of creating and issuing credentials.
credential-builder.credentials-tab.title: This tab is where you assemble and issue your credentials. Before you proceed to creating your first template, please make sure to provide details of the issuing organisation under the Organisations tab. If you wish to describe a learners achievements, activities, or other relevant aspects, please enter these under the respective tabs. You will need to provide references to these entries when you build your credential.
credential-builder.credentials-tab.noCre: No credentials have been provided yet
credential-builder.credentials-tab.addRe: Add as many Recipient you might need for issue
credential-builder.credentials-tab.toolt: The full official title of the issued credential.
Please select the organisation that issued the credential. For an organisation to appear in this list its details need to be entered under the 'Organisations' tab.
A summary of the claim or group of claims being made about a person (maximum 140 words). Typically should start with a verb, for example "has achieved", "is entitled to", "has attended", "knows".
Please select as many values as applicable. For learning activities to appear in this list their details need to be entered under the 'Activities' tab.
Please select as many values as applicable. For learning achievements to appear in this list their details need to be entered under the 'Achievements' tab.
Please select as many values as applicable. For learning entitlements to appear in this list their details need to be entered under the 'Entitlements' tab.
credential-builder.achievements-tab.titl: A Learning Achievement describes the acquisition of one or several learning outcomes. You may describe these, as well as related achievements, activities or entitlements, using the respective tabs. From the achievement form, you will be prompted to make references to these elements.
credential-builder.achievements-tab.tool: The awarding body that awarded the achievement to the individual.

The estimated number of hours the learner is expected to spend engaged in learning to earn the award. This would include the notional number of hours in class, in groupwork, in practicals, as well as hours engaged in self-motivated study.
If applicable, please first fill in the 'Learning outcomes' tab, then select here the expected learning outcomes of this learning specification.
Where the achievement is a qualification award, its level as mapped to the European Qualifications Framework.

Level on the Awarding Body's National Qualification Framework.
Where the opportunity is a qualification, its level as mapped to the offering institution's National Qualifications Framework.

Where the qualification is accredited, provide a link to the relevant accreditation record (either for institutional or programme accreditation). More information about the accreditation database is available here.
The assessment used to determine the level of the achievement. For an assessment to appear in this list it first must be created under the assessments tab.

Smaller units of achievement, which when combined make up this achievement.
If applicable, please enter all relevant achievements on this tab, then select the ones composing this.
The date when the Learning Specification was awarded.

Assessments which prove the acquisition of the learning outcomes which make up the achievement.
If applicable, please first provide details on the 'Assessment' tab, then select the assessment(s) that prove(s) this achievement.

Activities which contributed to the acquisition of the learning outcomes which make up the achievement.
If applicable, please first provide details on the 'Activities' tab, then select the activity (-ies) that are associated with this achievement.

Entitlements the owner has received ass a result of this achievement.
If applicable, please first provide details on the â€˜Entitlementsâ€™ tab, then select the entitlement(s) that are associated with this achievement.
This field should not be used to record information which is  captured by other parts of the model.
This field should not be used to record information which is  captured by other parts of the model.
Is the opportunity a partial qualification?

The criteria the person should meet to start this learning opportunity.
This field should not be used to describe the admissions procedure.
The maximum duration (in months) that a person may use to complete the learning opportunity.
Webpage describing the learning specification.
Thematic Area according to the ISCED-F Classification.
Other Web Documents describing the learning specification.
credential-builder.learning-outcomes-tab: A Learning Outcome is a statement regarding what a learner knows, understands and is able to do on completion of a learning process, which are defined in terms of knowledge, skills and responsibility and autonomy. Learning outcomes can also relate to knowledge and skills described in standardised classifications, such as ESCO

A detailed learning outcome may include a description of what the student can do as a result of learning, with an indication of the level of achievement, and the conditions or context under which this can be performed (if applicable).
credential-builder.activities-tab.title: A Learning Activity is a process which leads to the acquisition of knowledge, skills or responsibility and autonomy. It can be described in terms of a distinct start and end date, a specific location and workload.
credential-builder.activities-tab.otherW: Any other web documents describing the activity
credential-builder.activities-tab.toolti: The date the learner started the activity
The date the learner ended the activity
This field should not be used to record information which is captured by other parts of the model.
This field should not be used to record information which is captured by other parts of the model.
The location the activity took place
Any other web documents describing the activity specification

The actual number of hours the learner has spent engaged in the activity. This would include the number of hours in class, in groupwork, in practicals, as well as hours engaged in self-motivated study.

The organisation, or part of an organisation such as department, faculty, which directed the learning activity. For an organisation to appear in this list it needs to first be created under the organisations tab.
Smaller units of activity, which when combined make up this activity. For an activity to appear in this list it needs to first be created under the activities tab.

The estimated number of hours the learner is expected to spend engaged in the activity. This would include the notional number of hours in class, in groupwork, in practicals, as well as hours engaged in self-motivated study.
credential-builder.assessment-tab.subAct: Smaller units of activity, which when combined make up this activity. For an activity to appear in this list it needs to first be created under the activities tab.
credential-builder.assessment-tab.method: Method of assessment, supervision and ID verification
credential-builder.assessment-tab.title: An Assessment is the result of a process establishing the extent to which a learner has attained particular knowledge, skills and competence. Assessments can be linked to a specific grading scheme that rates the learnerâ€™s performance at the assessment.
credential-builder.assessment-tab.toolti: An identifier assigned to the assessment by the organisation grading the assessment
Webpage describing the details of the assessment specification
Other Web Documents describing the assessment specification
The Identifier of the Grading Scheme assigned to it by the organisation administering the scheme.
Please select the organisation that conducted the assessment. For an organisation to appear in this list its details need to be entered under the 'organisations' tab.
This field should not be used to record information which is captured by other parts of the model.

Smaller assessments, which when combined make up this assessment. If applicable, please first add new items on this tab, then select a related assessment that influenced the result of this assessment.
This field should not be used to record information which is captured by other parts of the model.
credential-builder.organizations-tab.tit: An Organisation is a legal person / registered entity that can issue the credential, conduct learning activities or assessments or that acknowledge credential holdersâ€™ entitlements.
credential-builder.organizations-tab.too: Accreditation Records associated with the organisation.
This should be the same number listed in the eSeal issued to the organisation.

Full legal name of the organisation, as registered with national authorities. The legal name should only translated into languages where official translations (submitted to national authorities) exist.
Use the format Country Code-Number, e.g. MT11111111
Use the format Country Code-Number, e.g. MT11111111
Please upload the organisation's logo in JPEG, JPG or PNG format.

A larger organisation of which this unit/sub-organisation forms part 
 For organisations to appear in this list their details need to be entered under this sheet.
credential-builder.entitlements-tab.titl: An Entitlement describes a right, e.g. to practice a profession, take advantage of a learning opportunity or join an organisation. Entitlements may be limited to a specific jurisdiction.
credential-builder.entitlements-tab.tool: The specific rights the holder of the credential has acquired. This field should not be used to record information which is  captured by other parts of the model.
Smaller entitlements, which when combined make up this entitlement. For an entitlement to appear in this list it needs to first be created under the entitlements tab.
A credential-holder may be entitled to membership of an organisation or professional association; to access a learning opportunity; or to perform a specific employment
An entitlement may be prospective, i.e. awarding the right to apply for the entitlement; or actual, i.e. granting the entitlement
The organisation which acknowledges the entitlement (i.e. the organisation offering the learning opportunity, membership or employment opportunity)
The region or country where the entitlement is valid.
The occupation or occupational class which the individual may access through the entitlement.
This field should not be used to record information which is  captured by other parts of the model.
credential-builder.entitlements-tab.othe: Any other web documents describing the entitlement
credential-builder.achievements-tab.noAc: No achievements have been provided yet
credential-builder.html-templates-tab.HT: Create your custom credential diploma templates in HTML + CSS (no JS) inside the EDC's XML structure. The template can use wildcards to choose EDC content (credential subject's name, titles, descriptions, etc.) and to show EDC non-related translatable labels ("certifies that", "has achieved", etc.) Some code samples and instructions on using credential wildcards are available in this downloadable document for you to customise your EDCs.
credential-builder.html-templates-tab.to: Please upload a background image that has a portrait orientation and DIN A4 ratio.
Please paste here the HTML code of your customised diploma. You can use wildcards to reference data from the Europass Learning Model or custom labels.
Provide label key attribute and the custom text that should appear on the customised diploma. Labels should be unique.
credential-builder.html-templates-tab.no: No Custom HTML Templates have been provided yet.
credential-builder.credentials-tab.toolt: Please select a customized html template for the credential. For html templates to appear in this list their details need to be entered under the 'HTML Template' tab.
